sen.j: 清水卯三郎（しみず うさぶろう、文政12年（1829年） - 明治43年（1910年）1月20日）は、武蔵国埼玉郡羽生村（現在の羽生市）出身の実業家。
sen.e: Usaburo SHIMIZU (1829 - January 20, 1910) is a known businessman who was born in Habu Village, Saitama District, Musashi Province. (currently it is Habu City)
Usaburo SHIMIZU (1829 - January 20, 1910) is a known businessman who was born in Habu Village, Saitama County, Musashi Province. (currently it is Habu City)
sen.cmt: ・「埼玉郡」をSaitama Countyとしました。
sen.e: Usaburo SHIMIZU (1829 - January 20, 1910) was a well-known businessman who was born in Habu Village, Saitama County, Musashi Province (currently it is Habu City).
sen.cmt: 内容を少し変更しました。

sen.e: His mother is the younger sister of Yuzan NEGISHI.
His mother is the younger sister of Yuzan NEGISHI.
His mother is the younger sister of Yuzan NEGISHI.

sen.j: 酒造業を営む清水家の三男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the third son of Shimizu family running a Japanese sake brewery.
He was born as the third son of the Shimizu family running a Japanese sake brewery.
sen.cmt: ・「清水家」に定冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: He was born as the third son of the Shimizu family running a Japanese sake brewery.

sen.j: 芳川波山に漢学を学んだ後、箕作阮甫に蘭学を学んだ。
sen.e: First he studied Sinology as a disciple of Hazan YOSHIKAWA, and then he studied Dutch learning (Western learning via Dutch influence) under Genpo MITSUKURI.
After learning Sinology from Hazan YOSHIKAWA, he studied Western learning under Genpo MITSUKURI.
sen.cmt: ・「…後」をAfterに言い換え、文全体もそれに伴い変更しました。・蘭学は、用語集の用語検索を参考に簡潔に言い換えました。
sen.e: After learning Sinology from Hazan YOSHIKAWA, he studied Western learning under Genpo MITSUKURI.

sen.j: 1854年（嘉永7年）には筒井政憲の供人として下田でロシア全権のエフィム・プチャーチンに会いロシア語を学んだ。
sen.e: In 1854, he had a chance to meet with Russian plenipotentiary Yevfimy Putyatin in Shimoda as an attendant of Masanori TSUTSUI, and he studied Russian.
sen.cmt: ロシア全権と会い、彼にロシア語を学んだのか、彼にあった影響でロシア語を学び始めたのか、詳しい事情がわかりませんので原文の通り単にロシア語を学んだという直訳的一文を加えたのみにしています。
sen.e: In 1854, he had a chance to meet Russian plenipotentiary Yevfimy Putyatin in Shimoda as an attendant of Masanori TSUTSUI, and he studied Russian.
sen.cmt: ・meet withとすると「約束して会う」というニュアンスになるのでwithは削除しました。・Putyatinと inの間のスペースを一つ削除しました。
sen.e: In 1854, he had a chance to meet Russian plenipotentiary Yevfimy Putyatin in Shimoda as an attendant of Masanori TSUTSUI, and he studied Russian.

sen.j: 1849年（嘉永2年）に江戸に出て大豆等を扱う商人となった。
sen.e: In 1849, SHIMIZU moved to Edo, and became a merchant to deal with soybean products.
In 1849, SHIMIZU moved to Edo, and became a merchant to deal with soybean products.
In 1849, SHIMIZU moved to Edo, and became a merchant to deal with soybean products.

sen.j: 1859年に横浜市、1868年に浅草に出店し、1869年（明治2年）には日本橋 (東京都中央区)に「瑞穂屋商店」を開設した。
sen.e: , He opened several stores; in 1859 in Yokohama City; in 1868, in Asakusa, Tokyo; in 1869, he opened "Mizuhoya Store" in Nihonbashi, Tokyo. (Chuo Ward, Tokyo Prefecture)
He opened several stores; in 1859 in Yokohama City; in 1868 in Asakusa, Tokyo; in 1869, he opened "Mizuhoya Store" in Nihonbashi, Tokyo. (Chuo Ward, Tokyo)
sen.cmt: ・文頭のカンマとスペースを削除しました。・1868の後のカンマを削除しました。・TokyoからPrefectureを削除しました。
sen.e: He opened several stores; in 1859 in Yokohama City; in 1868 in Asakusa, Tokyo; in 1869, he opened "Mizuhoya Store" in Nihonbashi, Tokyo (Chuo Ward, Tokyo).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: また外交面でも活躍し、1863年（文久3年）の薩英戦争の際には幕府側通訳として和平に尽力。
sen.e: He also engaged in the field of a foreign diplomacy, as he participated in the peace talks after the Anglo-Satsuma War in 1863 as an interpreter of Edo bakufu.
He also engaged in the field of foreign diplomacy, as he participated in the peace talks after the Anglo-Satsuma War in 1863 as an interpreter of Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: ・diplomacyは不可算名詞なのでaを削除しました。
sen.e: He also engaged in the field of foreign diplomacy, as he participated in the peace talks after the Anglo-Satsuma War in 1863 as an interpreter of Edo bakufu.

sen.j: イギリスに拘束されていた薩摩藩の五代友厚、寺島宗則を保護し、実家や親戚宅で匿っていたといわれる。
sen.e: SHIMIZU also took Tomoatsu GODAI and Munenori TERASHIMA of Satsuma Domain into protective custody by sheltering them at his family's or relative's home, after releasing them from the capture and custody of England.

SHIMIZU also took Tomoatsu GODAI and Munenori TERASHIMA of Satsuma Domain into protective custody by sheltering them at his family's or relative's home, after releasing them from the capture and custody of England.

SHIMIZU also took Tomoatsu GODAI and Munenori TERASHIMA of Satsuma Domain into protective custody by sheltering them at his family's or relative's home, after releasing them from the capture and custody of England.

sen.j: この活躍が認められ、1867年（慶応3年）に渋沢栄一らと共に幕命でフランスのパリ万国博覧会 (1867年)に随行、学問、工芸を学び、アメリカを経由して帰国した。
sen.e: This distinguished service was well recognized, and he was allowed to accompany with the participants of Paris International Exposition in France (1867) to study liberal arts and industrial arts, while he also visit the United States before he came back to Japan.

This distinguished service was well recognized, and he was allowed to accompany with the participants of Paris International Exposition in France (1867) to study liberal arts and industrial arts, while he also visit the United States before he came back to Japan.
sen.cmt: ・alsoと visitの間のスペースを一つ削除しました。
sen.e: This distinguished service was well recognized, and he was allowed to accompany with the participants of Paris International Exposition in France (1867) to study liberal arts and industrial arts, while he also visit the United States before he came back to Japan.

sen.j: 帰国後には洋書を皮切りに輸入商として活躍、その傍ら印刷を輸入して出版業を始め「六合新聞（りくごうしんぶん）」を出版し海外事情を紹介した。
sen.e: After this trip, he engaged in import business by importing foreign books, while he also started publishing business by importing printing equipment and method in order to introduce the news around the world through his "Rikugo shinbun-Newspaper."

After this trip, he engaged in import business by dealing with foreign books while he also started publishing business by importing printing equipment and method in order to introduce the news around the world through his "Rikugo shinbun-Newspaper."
sen.cmt: ・import、importingと同様の単語が二度でてくるので、二度目の方は別の熟語で言い換えました。・whileの前のカンマを削除しました。
sen.e: After this trip, he engaged in import business by dealing with foreign books while he also started publishing business by importing printing equipment and method in order to introduce the news around the world through his "Rikugo shinbun-Newspaper."

sen.j: また仮名 (文字)論者としても知られ、明六社の機関誌明六雑誌に、ひらがなの普及が国民全体の知識や教養の向上に役立つと主張した。
sen.e: He is also known as a kana (the Japanese syllabary) advocate, and he expressed his opinion in an article on a magazine of Meiroku Company, regarding the necessity of spreading hiragana (the rounded Japanese phonetic syllabary) throughout the country to improve the knowledge and culture of entire citizens.

He is also known as a kana (the Japanese syllabary) advocate, and he expressed his opinion in an article on a magazine of Meirokusha (Japan's first academic society), regarding the necessity of spreading hiragana (the rounded Japanese phonetic syllabary) throughout the country to improve the knowledge and culture of entire citizens.
sen.cmt: ・「明六社」は用語集の用語検索を参考に（）内の説明を追加しました。
sen.e: He is also known as a kana (the Japanese syllabary) advocate, and he expressed his opinion in an article on a magazine of Meirokusha (Japan's first academic society), regarding the necessity of spreading hiragana (the rounded Japanese phonetic syllabary) throughout the country to improve the knowledge and culture of entire citizens.

sen.j: この考えに賛同した学者達と「かなのとも」という会を発足させ、機関誌『かなのみちびき』を発行し、仮名文字論を展開した。
sen.e: He founded an association group called "Kana no tomo" (The friends of kana alphabet) with scholars who supported his opinion, and published a magazine, "Kana no michibiki" (The guiding of kana alphabet) to develop their theory of kana alphabet usage.

He founded an association called "Kana no tomo" (The friends of kana alphabet) with scholars who supported his opinion, and published a magazine, "Kana no michibiki" (The guiding of kana alphabet) to develop their theory of kana alphabet usage.
sen.cmt: ・ associationだけで、組織を意味するのでgroupは削除しました。
sen.e: He founded an association called "Kana no tomo" (The friends of kana alphabet) with scholars who supported his opinion, and published a magazine, "Kana no michibiki" (The guiding of kana alphabet) to develop their theory of kana alphabet usage.

sen.j: また1874年（明治7年）には英国の科学の本を翻訳した「ものわりのはしご」を出版、晩年に半生記「わがよのき」を書き残したが、これらは全て仮名文字で記されている。
sen.e: In 1874, he published a book called "Monowari no hashigo," a translated British science book; he also left his writing, "Wagayo no ki" (the writing about my life) all written in kana alphabet.
sen.cmt: 著作名「ものわりのはしご」ですが、原著名がわかりません。平仮名のため、どういう意味かも確定できませんので読みのみ訳に入れています。
sen.e: In 1874, he published a book called "Monowari no hashigo," a translated British science book; he also left his writing, "Wagayo no ki" (the writing about my life) all written in kana alphabet.
In 1874, he published a book called "Monowari no hashigo," a translated British science book; he also left his writing, "Wagayo no ki" (the writing about my life) all written in kana alphabet.
He died on January 20, 1910 at the age of 82.

sen.j: 羽生市北の正光寺にある清水卯三郎の墓には「志みづうさぶらうのはか」と記されている。
sen.e: On the tombstone of Usaburo SHIMIZU located in Shoko-ji Temple in the northern part of Habu City, it is written as "SHIMIZU Usaburo no haka" (the tobm of Usaburo SHIMIZU) in kana alphabet. (except the character "SHI" of SHIMIZU written in Chinese character)
sen.cmt: 旧仮名遣いのため、正確を期すのであれば「SHIMIDU USABURAU」となるかと思いますが、かなり長い別途説明が必要となり、それを加えると非常に分かりづらくなるため「SHI」の字のみ漢字になっているという説明を加えた以外は言及を避けています。
sen.e: On the tombstone of Usaburo SHIMIZU located in Shoko-ji Temple in the northern part of Habu City, it is written as "SHIMIZU Usaburo no haka" (the tomb of Usaburo SHIMIZU) in kana alphabet. (except the character "SHI" of SHIMIZU written in Chinese character "志")
sen.cmt: ・翻訳者のコメントより「SHI」の字のみ漢字になっているという説明を加えるなら、「志」という漢字も入れておく方がより読み手にも具体的だと考え追加しました。・tombにtypoがあり、修正しました。
sen.e: On the tombstone of Usaburo SHIMIZU located in Shoko-ji Temple in the northern part of Habu City, it is written as "SHIMIZU Usaburo no haka" (the tomb of Usaburo SHIMIZU) in kana alphabet (except the character "SHI" of SHIMIZU written in Chinese character "志").
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
